title.narrative: 4.5. EDUCATION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Zonal and regional authorities and partners are prepared to support emergency affected primary school age children with access to child friendly temporary learning spaces including essential learning and recreational materials, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, 850,000 children and young people (from 5 to 24 years old) have access to quality education opportunities

title.narrative: Zonal and regional authorities and partners are prepared to support emergency affected primary school age children with access tochild friendly temporary learning spaces including essential learning and recreational materials

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s Education in Emergencies (EiE) pre-famine response has reached cumulative 118,518 (45 per cent female) children (or over 174,000 when combining contributions to EiE responses under other Output areas of the country programme), which accounts for 75 per cent of the entire cluster results in Somalia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/01/2018
